arts.ttl: European football: Paulo Dybala makes difference for Roma at ailing Venezia
arts.sum: Argentinian scores first goal of 2025 in 1-0 win in Venice Second-half penalty came after Angeliño was tripped Paulo Dybala scored his first goal of 2025 to help a much-changed Roma team to a 1-0 win at relegation-threatened Venezia in Serie A on Sunday. Dybala powerfully converted a second-half penalty after his teammate Angeliño was tripped by the Venezia defender Alessandro Marcandalli. The Roma manager, Claudio Ranieri, had opted to rotate his team ahead of Thursday’s Europa League playoff first leg against Porto. Roma remained ninth in Serie A. Their city rivals Lazio can move back up to fourth with a win over bottom club Monza later. Venezia were second from bottom, three points above Monza and five below safety. Napoli will be looking to extend their lead at the top of the table when they host Udinese. This story will be updated Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Roma Secures Crucial Victory: Ranieri Praises Team’s Best Performance
arts.sum: In a hard-fought match at the Penzo Stadium, Roma emerged victorious against Venezia with a 1-0 win, courtesy of a Paulo Dybala penalty in the 57th minute. Following the game, Roma's manager Claudio Ranieri shared his thoughts on the team's performance, expressing satisfaction with their display. The post Roma Secures Crucial Victory: Ranieri Praises Team’s Best Performance appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Venezia 0-1 Roma: Match Report
arts.sum: In a closely contested match, Roma emerged victorious with a 1-0 win over Venezia, thanks to a second-half penalty converted by Paulo Dybala. This result extends Roma's unbeaten league streak and marks their fifth win in eight Serie A matches under Claudio Ranieri's guidance. The post Serie A | Venezia 0-1 Roma: Match Report appeared first on FootItalia.com.
